text: Structure: Left panel (F): Female burden, bars extend right Right panel (M): Male burden, bars extend right Y-axis: Age groups (youngest bottom, oldest top) X-axis: Burden metric (absolute scale shown) Colors: Different color infection type Error bars: Black horizontal lines showing 95% confidence intervals read: Bar length: Longer bars = higher burden age-sex group Side--side comparison: Direct visual comparison male vs.¬†female Grouped bars: multiple infections selected, appear side--side within age group Error bars: Wider error bars = uncertainty Common young (0-1) old (85+) groups due smaller samples look : Age patterns: age groups longest bars? burden concentrated elderly (typical)? unexpected patterns younger groups? Sex differences: bars consistently longer one side? patterns differ infection type? sex differences larger certain age groups? Infection-specific patterns: different infections show different age distributions? infections primarily affect elderly? infections evenly distributed? Uncertainty: groups wide confidence intervals? data/surveillance needed? Example interpretation: see: long bars ages 65-84 85+ Slightly longer bars male side Wide error bars age 0-1 Conclusion: Elderly populations (65+) carry highest burden (typical finding) Males may slightly higher burden females (due healthcare utilization biological factors) Infant data high uncertainty (may need surveillance group)

title: Introduction to healthburdenr
text: healthburdenr package provides tools analyzing visualizing burden healthcare-associated infections (HAIs) using data German European Union Point Prevalence Surveys (PPS).

title: Introduction to healthburdenr
text: Healthcare-Associated Infections (HAIs) infections patients acquire course receiving healthcare treatment. infections present incubating time admission represent significant public health challenge.

title: Introduction to healthburdenr
text: BHAI (Burden Healthcare-Associated Infections) systematic methodology developed estimate population-level burden HAIs. combines surveillance data Point Prevalence Surveys epidemiological modeling quantify: Cases: Annual number infection episodes Deaths: Mortality directly attributable HAIs DALYs: Disability-Adjusted Life Years (overall population health loss) YLL: Years Life Lost due premature mortality YLD: Years Lived Disability due infection morbidity methodology uses Monte Carlo simulation (500 runs) provide point estimates 95% confidence intervals, accounting uncertainty underlying data.

code: # Filter for "ALL" row (total across infections) total_burden <- bhai_pop_est |>   filter(infection == "ALL") |>   select(country, cases_point_estimate, deaths_point_estimate, daly_point_estimate)  print(total_burden) #> # A tibble: 2 √ó 4 #>   country        cases_point_estimate deaths_point_estimate daly_point_estimate #>   <chr>                         <int>                 <int>               <int> #> 1 Germany                      478745                 16439              253586 #> 2 European Union              2365538                 77510             1469746 # CFR by infection cfr_by_infection <- bhai_pop_est |>   filter(infection != "ALL") |>   mutate(     cfr_pct = (deaths_point_estimate / cases_point_estimate) * 100   ) |>   select(country, infection, cases_point_estimate, deaths_point_estimate, cfr_pct) |>   arrange(country, desc(cfr_pct))  print(cfr_by_infection) #> # A tibble: 10 √ó 5 #>    country        infection cases_point_estimate deaths_point_estimate cfr_pct #>    <chr>          <chr>                    <int>                 <int>   <dbl> #>  1 European Union BSI                     112046                 16959   15.1  #>  2 European Union CDI                      81191                  4611    5.68 #>  3 European Union HAP                     728270                 26548    3.65 #>  4 European Union SSI                     560543                 12900    2.30 #>  5 European Union UTI                     882930                 15078    1.71 #>  6 Germany        BSI                      26801                  3841   14.3  #>  7 Germany        CDI                      36355                  2064    5.68 #>  8 Germany        HAP                     107168                  4113    3.84 #>  9 Germany        SSI                      92425                  2300    2.49 #> 10 Germany        UTI                     213207                  3754    1.76

text: Identify highest-burden age groups: Visualize sex differences:
code: # Sum cases across infections by age group age_burden <- bhai_strata_summary |>   filter(country == "Germany") |>   group_by(age_group, sex) |>   summarise(     total_cases = sum(ncases_estimate),     total_deaths = sum(ndeath_estimate),     .groups = "drop"   ) |>   arrange(desc(total_cases))  head(age_burden, 10) #> # A tibble: 10 √ó 4 #>    age_group sex   total_cases total_deaths #>    <fct>     <chr>       <dbl>        <dbl> #>  1 70-74     M          81871.        3135. #>  2 85-120    F          78311.        2321. #>  3 75-79     F          77247.        2629. #>  4 70-74     F          76842.        2338. #>  5 80-84     F          76050.        2348. #>  6 75-79     M          68859.        2352. #>  7 80-84     M          60463.        2043. #>  8 65-69     M          50232.        2156. #>  9 85-120    M          46612.        1639. #> 10 65-69     F          45704.        1708. ggplot(age_burden, aes(x = age_group, y = total_cases, fill = sex)) +   geom_col(position = "dodge") +   coord_flip() +   labs(     title = "HAI Cases by Age Group and Sex (Germany)",     x = "Age Group",     y = "Total Cases",     fill = "Sex"   ) +   theme_minimal()

text: Provides tools interactive visualizations exploring healthcare-associated infection (HAI) burden estimates based point prevalence survey data European acute-care hospitals (2011-2012). title: Launch the BHAI Interactive Dashboard ‚Äî run_app
text: Launches interactive Shiny dashboard exploring Burden Healthcare-Associated Infections (BHAI) data 2011-2012 European Point Prevalence Survey. dashboard includes three main tabs: Overview: Survey sample distribution interactive treemap visualization Population Estimates: Annual burden estimates bubble charts detailed tables Stratified Analysis: Demographic breakdown age sex diverging bar charts
